title: Pam's Ranch Chicken
description: Served with Roasted Broccoli & Baked Potato

refrigerator: Butter, sour cream, toppings (for baked potato)
pantry: Olive oil, salt, pepper, garlic powder (for broccoli)

sections.title: üßë‚Äçüç≥ Recipe
items: Preheat oven to 375¬∞F. Spray a 9√ó13-inch baking dish with cooking spray.
In a shallow plate, mix ranch dressing mix, parmesan cheese, and breadcrumbs.
In another plate, add mayonnaise.
Dredge chicken in mayo, then in breadcrumb mixture. Place in prepared dish.
Bake for 40 minutes, or until internal temperature hits 165¬∞F.
Chop broccoli into florets. Toss with olive oil, salt, pepper, and garlic powder.
Spread on a baking sheet and roast at 400¬∞F for 20‚Äì25 minutes until crispy at the edges.
Scrub potatoes and prick with a fork. Rub with oil and salt.
Bake directly on oven rack at 425¬∞F for 45‚Äì60 minutes until soft.
Serve with butter, sour cream, and desired toppings.

sections.title: üçΩÔ∏è Estimated Nutrition (Per Serving)
items: Calories: ~600
Protein: ~45g
Carbs: ~35g
Fat: ~28g
Fiber: ~6g

pantry: Water, broth, or dry red wine

sections.title: üßë‚Äçüç≥ Recipe
items: 1 lb dried spaghetti
1 lb ground meat (beef or turkey)
3 tbsp olive oil
1 cup chopped onion
3 garlic cloves (1 tbsp), minced
2 tbsp tomato paste
1/2 tsp dried oregano
Pinch crushed red pepper flakes
1 cup water, broth, or red wine
1 (28oz) can crushed tomatoes
Salt & fresh ground black pepper
Handful fresh basil leaves, plus extra for serving
Grated parmesan cheese, for serving
Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium-high heat.
Add ground meat and cook until browned (8 minutes), breaking up as it cooks.
Add onions and cook until softened (5 minutes).
Stir in garlic, tomato paste, oregano, red pepper flakes; cook for 1 minute.
Pour in water/broth/wine and scrape up any bits from the bottom.
Add crushed tomatoes, 3/4 tsp salt, and black pepper; stir to combine.
Simmer uncovered for 25 minutes, stirring and adjusting seasoning as needed.
Meanwhile, cook pasta in salted water according to package (check early for doneness).
Remove sauce from heat, stir in fresh basil, then toss with cooked pasta.
Let sit 1 minute to absorb, toss again, and serve with parmesan cheese.

sections.title: üçΩÔ∏è Estimated Nutrition (Per Serving)
items: Calories: ~500
Protein: ~28g
Carbs: ~50g
Fat: ~18g
Fiber: ~5g

refrigerator: Toppings: cheese, sour cream, tomatoes, lettuce, avocado, hot sauce, etc.

sections.title: üßë‚Äçüç≥ Recipe
items: Place chicken breasts in the bottom of the slow cooker insert.
Sprinkle taco seasoning evenly over the chicken.
Top with diced onion, then pour tomatoes and green chiles over the top (do not stir).
Cover and cook on LOW for 6‚Äì8 hours or HIGH for 4‚Äì5 hours.
Remove lid and shred the chicken using two forks.
Add chopped cilantro and stir to combine.
Serve in tortillas or burrito bowls with your favorite toppings.
Optional: Use leftovers for enchiladas or nachos!

sections.title: üçΩÔ∏è Estimated Nutrition (Per Serving)

Carbs: ~18g (plus tortilla/topping dependent)
Fat: ~16g
Fiber: ~3g

title: Butter Chicken
description: Creamy Indian-inspired chicken in a tomato butter sauce

sections.title: üßë‚Äçüç≥ Recipe
items: Preheat oven to 375¬∞F (190¬∞C).
Melt 2 tablespoons butter in a skillet over medium heat.
Add minced onion and garlic. Cook until onion caramelizes to dark brown (about 15 minutes).
In a separate saucepan, combine heavy cream, tomato sauce, remaining butter, salt, cayenne pepper, and garam masala. Bring to a simmer.
Reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer for 30 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Stir in caramelized onions.
While sauce simmers, toss chicken with vegetable oil and season with tandoori masala.
Spread chicken on a baking sheet and bake for ~12 minutes, until no longer pink in the center.
Add cooked chicken to the sauce and simmer for 5 more minutes before serving.

sections.title: üçΩÔ∏è Estimated Nutrition (Per Serving)
items: Calories: ~650
Protein: ~40g
Carbs: ~12g
Fat: ~50g
Fiber: ~1g

title: Hot Honey Ground Beef Bowls
description: Sweet potato and avocado taco bowls with seasoned beef, cottage cheese, and hot honey.

sections.title: üßë‚Äçüç≥ Recipe
items: Preheat oven to 425¬∞F. Line a half baking sheet with parchment paper.
Peel and wash sweet potatoes. Cut into ~1/4" cubes.
Spread cubes on baking sheet, lightly spray with oil, and season with salt, pepper, and cinnamon.
Bake sweet potatoes for 30 minutes, flipping halfway through. Re-season at halfway point if desired.
While potatoes bake, heat a skillet over medium-high and cook ground beef until fully browned (about 5 minutes). Drain excess fat.
Add tomato paste, taco seasoning, and a splash of water. Cook 1‚Äì2 more minutes until well mixed. Remove from heat.
To serve, build bowls with roasted sweet potatoes, seasoned beef, cottage cheese, and sliced avocado.
Drizzle with hot honey to finish. Enjoy!

sections.title: üçΩÔ∏è Estimated Nutrition (Per Serving)

Protein: ~35g
Carbs: ~35g
Fat: ~30g
Fiber: ~6g

title: Shrimp Bowl with Avocado Crema
description: A delicious and healthy shrimp bowl topped with creamy avocado crema, perfect for a quick meal.

freezer: 1 pound large shrimp, peeled and deveined
1 cup fresh or frozen corn kernels
pantry: 1 tablespoon finely chopped chipotle chile in adobo

sections.title: üë©‚Äçüç≥ Recipe
items: Stir shrimp, chipotle and 1 tablespoon oil together in a medium bowl. Set aside.
Place avocado, 1/2 cup cilantro, yogurt, lime juice and 1/8 teaspoon salt in a mini food processor. Process until mostly smooth.

Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add the shrimp and cook, stirring once or twice, until just cooked through, about 4 minutes. Transfer to a bowl and cover to keep warm.

Add the remaining 1 tablespoon oil, 1/2 teaspoon cumin, 1/2 teaspoon garlic powder and 1/4 teaspoon salt. Stir to combine. Add cauliflower rice, scallions and water. Cook, stirring, until tender, about 5 minutes.
Combine beans with the remaining 1/4 teaspoon cumin, 1/4 teaspoon garlic powder and 1/8 teaspoon salt in a small bowl.
Combine corn and the remaining 2 tablespoons cilantro in another small bowl.
To serve, divide the cauliflower mixture among 4 bowls. Top with the shrimp, beans, corn and avocado crema.

sections.title: üçΩÔ∏è Estimated Nutrition (Per Serving)
items: Calories: ~400
Protein: ~30g
Carbohydrates: ~45g
Fat: ~15g
Fiber: ~10g

title: Tuna Melt
description: A classic tuna melt sandwich with a delicious blend of tuna, mayonnaise, and vegetables, topped with melted cheddar cheese.

sections.title: üë©‚Äçüç≥ Recipe
items: In a medium sized bowl combine the tuna, mayonnaise, celery, red onion, dijon mustard, parsley, salt and pepper.
Butter one side of each slice of bread. Putting the butter side down add the cheese on the unbuttered side. Add the tuna mixture on top. Top with tomato and additional cheese.

Skillet Method: Preheat a skillet to medium heat. Add the sandwich on the skillet and heat for about 2-3 minutes until cheese starts to melt and it is golden brown. Flip to the other side and cook until the cheese is fully melted and sandwich is golden brown.
Broiler Method: Preheat a broiler. Spread the bread butter side up and toast for a couple of minutes. Top with cheese, tuna mixture and Broil for 2-3 minutes until cheese is melted.

sections.title: üçΩÔ∏è Estimated Nutrition (Per Serving)
items: Calories: ~400
Protein: ~25g
Carbohydrates: ~30g
Fat: ~20g

title: Healthy Air Fryer Turkey Meatballs with Zoodles
description: A delicious and healthy meal featuring turkey meatballs cooked in an air fryer, served with spiralized zucchini noodles.

refrigerator: 1 1/2 pounds zoodles (spiralized zucchini noodles, from about 3 medium zucchinis)
pantry: 1 tablespoon finely grated Parmesan, plus more for serving

sections.title: üë©‚Äçüç≥ Recipe
items: Toss the zoodles with a good pinch of salt in a large bowl. Let sit until the zoodles begin to soften and release some excess liquid, about 10 minutes. Pat them dry and set aside.
Meanwhile, combine the breadcrumbs and milk in a medium bowl and let sit while the breadcrumbs soften and absorb most of the liquid, about 5 minutes.

Add the turkey, ricotta, parsley, Parmesan, oregano, 1/2 teaspoon salt and several grinds of pepper to the breadcrumb mixture, then mix thoroughly with your hands to combine. Form into 12 meatballs (each about 1 1/2 tablespoons and 1 inch wide).

Preheat an air fryer to 400 degrees F. Add the meatballs, leaving some space between each for air circulation. Air fry until golden brown on the outside and just cooked through, about 10 minutes, turning the meatballs about halfway through the cooking time.
Meanwhile, warm the tomato sauce in a medium saucepan set over medium heat. Add the meatballs to the sauce, lower the heat to low and keep warm.
Season the zoodles with a 1/4 teaspoon salt and several grinds of pepper. Air fry at 400 degrees F, tossing halfway through, until tender and starting to brown at the edges, 5 to 6 minutes.
Divide the zoodles between 2 dinner plates or shallow bowls, then top each with 6 meatballs and spoon the warm tomato sauce over top. Serve with a sprinkle of Parmesan.

sections.title: üçΩÔ∏è Estimated Nutrition (Per Serving)

title: Shakshuka
description: Recipe generated by AI based on input

sections.title: üìù Generated Recipe Text
sections.content:
## Shakshuka Recipe

**Ingredients:**

* 2 tablespoons olive oil
* 1 medium onion, diced
* 1 red bell pepper, seeded and diced
* 4 garlic cloves, finely chopped
* 2 teaspoons paprika
* 1 teaspoon cumin
* ¬º teaspoon chili powder
* 1 (28-ounce) can whole peeled tomatoes
* 6 large eggs
* Salt and pepper, to taste
* 1 small bunch fresh cilantro, chopped
* 1 small bunch fresh parsley, chopped


**Instructions:**

1. Heat olive oil in a large saut√© pan on medium heat.
2. Add the chopped bell pepper and onion and cook for 5 minutes, or until the onion becomes translucent.
3. Add garlic and spices and cook for an additional minute.
4. Pour the can of tomatoes and juice into the pan and break down the tomatoes using a large spoon. Season with salt and pepper and bring the sauce to a simmer.
5. Use your large spoon to make small wells in the sauce and crack the eggs into each well.
6. Cook the eggs for 5 to 8 minutes, or until the eggs are done to your liking. You can also cover the pan with a lid to expedite the eggs cooking.
7. Garnish with chopped cilantro and parsley before serving.

title: Spinach Artichoke Gnocchi Skillet with Feta
description: A delicious and creamy gnocchi skillet featuring spinach, artichokes, and feta cheese.

freezer: 1 (12-ounce) package frozen artichoke hearts, thawed and chopped

sections.title: üë©‚Äçüç≥ Recipe
items: Heat 2 tablespoons oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add sliced garlic; cook, stirring often, until golden brown, about 5 minutes. Remove from heat; using a slotted spoon, transfer the garlic to a paper towel‚Äìlined plate. Reserve the oil in the pan.

Add 2 tablespoons butter to the oil in the pan; swirl over medium-high heat until melted. Add 12 ounces gnocchi; cook, stirring and tossing occasionally, until golden brown and crisp, 8 to 10 minutes. Spoon into a medium bowl. Reserve the oil in the pan.

Add 1 (5-ounce) package baby spinach and the chopped artichoke hearts to the pan; cook over medium heat, stirring and folding until the spinach has just wilted, about 2 minutes. Return the gnocchi to the pan; stir to combine.

Remove from heat; add ¬Ω cup heavy cream and ¬º cup feta. Stir until incorporated and creamy, about 1 minute. Add 2 tablespoons lemon juice and 1 teaspoon Italian seasoning; stir to combine. Top with 1 tablespoon chives, the remaining ¬º cup feta and the reserved crispy garlic.

title: Green Masala Eggs
description: Recipe generated by AI based on input

sections.title: üìù Generated Recipe Text
sections.content:
**Green Masala Eggs**

**Ingredients:**

* 6 eggs
* 350g brown basmati rice
* 2 tbsp rapeseed oil
* 1 onion, finely sliced
* 2cm piece ginger, grated
* 1 tsp turmeric
* 1 tsp chilli powder
* 1 tsp ground coriander
* 400ml can coconut milk
* 2 green chillies, finely sliced
* 1 tsp mango chutney
* Small pack coriander


**Instructions:**

**Step 1:** Lower the eggs into a pan of boiling water and cook for 6 minutes.  Lift them out and cool under cold running water. Cook the rice following pack instructions.

**Step 2:** Heat a little of the oil in a deep frying pan and cook the onions until soft. Add the ginger and cook for 1 minute, then stir in the turmeric, chilli powder and coriander. Cook for 1-2 minutes, or until fragrant. Add the coconut milk, most of the chillies, and the mango chutney. Bring to a simmer and cook for 5 minutes.

**Step 3:** Meanwhile, heat the rest of the oil in a frying pan or wok. Peel the eggs and stir them around in the hot oil until they brown, bubble, and crisp all over. Lift them carefully out of the pan and halve them.

**Step 4:** Roughly chop the coriander and stir most of it into the masala with some salt. Add the eggs, scatter the rest of the chilli and coriander over the top, and serve with the rice.

title: recipe
description: Recipe generated by AI based on input

content.title: Green masala eggs
content.description: A recipe for green masala eggs with brown basmati rice.

sections.title: Ingredients
items: 6 eggs
350g brown basmati rice
2 tbsp rapeseed oil
1 onion, finely sliced
2cm piece ginger, grated
1 tsp turmeric
1 tsp chilli powder
1 tsp ground coriander
400ml can coconut milk
2 green chillies, finely sliced
1 tsp mango chutney
small pack coriander

sections.title: Instructions
items: Lower the eggs into a pan of boiling water and cook for 6 mins, then lift them out and cool under cold running water. Cook the rice following pack instructions.

Heat a little of the oil in a deep frying pan and cook the onions until soft. Add the ginger and cook for 1 min, then stir in the turmeric, chilli powder and coriander and cook for 1-2 mins or until fragrant. Add the coconut milk, most of the chillies and the mango chutney, bring to a simmer and cook for 5 mins.

Meanwhile, heat the rest of the oil in a frying pan or wok. Peel the eggs and stir them around in the hot oil until they brown and start to bubble and crisp all over. Lift them carefully out of the pan and halve them.
Roughly chop the coriander and stir most of it into the masala with some salt. Add the eggs, scatter the rest of the chilli and coriander over the top and serve with the rice.
